place.name: GREAT BENTLEY
place.gazetteerText: BENTLEY (Great), a village and a parish in Tendring district, Essex. The village stands near the Tendring Hundred railway, 8 miles SE by E of Colchester; and has a post office under Colchester, a railway station, and an annual fair. The parish comprises 3,188 acres. Real property, £5,380. Pop., 1,033. Houses, 235. The property is subdivided. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Rochester. Value, £360.* Patron, the Bishop of Rochester. The church is very good; and there are a Wesleyan chapel and a national school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
